Articles.Content: I want to know how to balance my craft's reaction wheels, could someone make a little bubble like with mass, lift, and thrust? Maybe with curved arrows showing rotation? I recently saw some mods that do this with RCS, but I've wanted it for a while. It's gotta be easier than RCS, right?
You don't need to balance reaction wheels.

Reaction wheels apply the same torque to the vessel regardless of location. The only thing to watch out for is that the ship is rigid enough to not bend too much when that torque is applied. If using multiple wheels, it is best to spread them out around the ship.

If using multiple wheels, it is best to spread them out around the ship.

What good would that do?

It reduces the tendency of the ship to bend when torque is applied. Not a big deal on monolithic ships that are sufficiently strutted, but can be significant on things built in orbit with floppy docking port connections.
I'm quite sure it doesn't. All the torque is simply summed up and applied at CoM.
I thought so too until I saw the effect demonstrated in one of Kasuha's experiments here.
I wonder if that experiment will work with all parts (including reaction wheels) having the same mass.
Not sure but I think it should. I'm not at my KSP PC to try it, perhaps if I have some time tonight I'll try it. Should be easier to do now that we have smaller wheels available.
I still really think it would be useful though....it could make your ship move in certain ways.
